intro: Helianthostylis sprucei, commonly known as the mountain helianthemum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to the high-altitude regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant features showy yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs, adapted to the cool, moist conditions of its habitat. Helianthostylis sprucei is often found growing in rocky soils and open slopes, showcasing its resilience to harsh environmental conditions.
